Avoid contractions to create formal tone. Change to “they are.” And make sure you don’t mean “there” (as in “there are no more donuts in there”) or “their” (as in “their reason for eating the donuts is that they were hungry).

Today or Now (And don’t forget a comma if this begins the sentence.)
Today, Now, Currently, Presently (Pick one. And don’t forget a comma if this begins the sentence.)
Make sure you don’t mean “fewer.” If it can be counted, you probably mean fewer. (less furniture / fewer chairs)
Make sure you don’t mean “fewer.” If it can be counted, you probably mean fewer. (less furniture / fewer chairs)
You probably mean “could not care less.”
Be more specific. “Society” is too general and rarely applies well to a claim. Maybe you mean something like, “in modern American culture” or “throughout many industrialized countries.”
Be more specific. “Society” is too general and rarely applies well to a claim. Maybe you mean something like, “in modern American culture” or “throughout many industrialized countries.”
Unless you are using this word as a verb (like to “stuff” donuts into your food hole), than it is informal and could be replaced with a better word—“items” perhaps.
Unless you are using this word as a verb (like to “stuff” donuts into your food hole), than it is informal and could be replaced with a better word—“items” perhaps.
This is acceptable as a noun (a battle of good versus evil), but it is usually weak as an adjective (The dog was good on his walk; he didn’t bite anyone.)

If you are using this word as part of a claim, you MUST provide evidence to prove >50%. Without that evidence, use a safer word like “many.”
